member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ActionCommand
member.summary: A basic implementation of ICommand that wraps a method that takes no parameters or a method that takes one parameter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ActionCommand.#ctor(System.Action)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The action.
member.remarks: Use this constructor to provide an action that ignores the ICommand parameter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ActionCommand.#ctor(System.Action{System.Object})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An action that takes an object parameter.
member.remarks: Use this constructor to provide an action that uses the object parameter passed by the Execute method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ActionCommand.System#Windows#Input#ICommand#CanExecute(System.Object)
member.summary: Defines the method that determines whether the command can execute in its current state.
member.param: Data used by the command. If the command does not require data to be passed, this object can be set to null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ActionCommand.Execute(System.Object)
member.summary: Defines the method to be called when the command is invoked.
member.param: Data used by the command. If the command does not require data to be passed, this object can be set to null.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ActionCommand.System#Windows#Input#ICommand#CanExecuteChanged
member.summary: Occurs when changes occur that affect whether the command should execute. Will not be fired by ActionCommand.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ChangePropertyAction
member.summary: An action that will change a specified property to a specified value when invoked.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ChangePropertyAction.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ChangePropertyAction.Invoke(System.Object)
member.summary: Invokes the action.
member.param: The parameter to the action. If the Action does not require a parameter, the parameter may be set to a null reference.
member.exception: A property with could not be found on the Target.
Could not set to the value specified by .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ChangePropertyAction.PropertyName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the property to change. This is a dependency property.
member.value: The name of the property to change.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ChangePropertyAction.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value to set. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ChangePropertyAction.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the duration of the animation that will occur when the ChangePropertyAction is invoked. This is a dependency property. If the duration is unset, no animation will be applied.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ExtendedVisualStateManager
member.summary: ExtendedVisualStateManager is a custom VisualStateManager that can smooth out the animation of layout properties. With this custom VisualStateManager, states can include changes to properties like Grid.Column, can change element heights to or from Auto, and so on. These changes will be smoothed out over time using the GeneratedDuration and GeneratedEasingFunction of the appropriate transition. See the "VisualStateManager overrides" region below for a general description of the algorithm.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ExtendedVisualStateManager.UseFluidLayoutProperty
member.summary: A VisualStateGroup can use Fluid Layout or not.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ExtendedVisualStateManager.RuntimeVisibilityPropertyProperty
member.summary: Visibility is shadowed by a custom attached property at runtime.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ExtendedVisualStateManager.OriginalLayoutValuesProperty
member.summary: A VisualStateGroup keeps a list of these original values in an attached property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ExtendedVisualStateManager.LayoutStoryboardProperty
member.summary: For every state, the layout-specific properties get extracted and then are attached to the state. These properties are removed from the state itself.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ExtendedVisualStateManager.CurrentStateProperty
member.summary: Remember the current state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ExtendedVisualStateManager.MovingElements
member.summary: This is the set of elements that are currently in motion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ExtendedVisualStateManager.LayoutTransitionStoryboard
member.summary: This is the storyboard that is animating the transition.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ExtendedVisualStateManager.LayoutProperties
member.summary: This list contains all the known layout properties.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ExtendedVisualStateManager.StopAnimations
member.summary: Stop the animation and replace the layout changes that were made to support that animation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ExtendedVisualStateManager.FindTransition(System.Windows.VisualStateGroup,System.Windows.VisualState,System.Windows.VisualState)
member.summary: Locate the transition that VisualStateManager will use to animate the change, so that the layout animation can match the duration and ease.
member.param: The group in which the transition is taking place
The state that you are coming from
The state you are going to

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ExtendedVisualStateManager.ExtractLayoutStoryboard(System.Windows.VisualState)
member.summary: Remove all layout-affecting properties from the Storyboard for the state and cache them in an attached property.
member.param: The state you are moving to
member.returns: A Storyboard containing the layout properties in that state

member.summary:
The set of target elements is the set of all elements that might have moved in a layout transition. This set is the closure of: - Elements with layout properties animated in the state. - Siblings of elements in the set. - Parents of elements in the set.
Subsequent code will check these rectangles both before and after the layout change.
member.param: The control whose layout is changing state
The storyboard containing the layout changes
Any previous values from previous state navigations that might be reverted
The set of elements currently in motion, if there is a state change transition ongoing
member.returns: The full set of elements whose layout may have changed

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ExtendedVisualStateManager.GetRectsOfTargets(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Windows.FrameworkElement},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Windows.FrameworkElement})
member.summary: Get a set of rectangles for all the elements in the target list.
member.param: The set of elements to consider
The set of elements currently in motion
member.returns: A Dictionary mapping elements to their rects

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ExtendedVisualStateManager.GetLayoutRect(System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary: Get the layout rectangle of an element, by getting the layout slot and then computing which portion of the slot is being used.
member.param: The element whose rect we want to get
member.returns: The layout rect of that element

member.summary: Get the opacities of elements at the time of the state change, instead of visibilities, because the state change may be in process and the current value is the most important.
member.param: The control whose state is changing
The storyboard with the layout properties
The set of original values

member.summary: Go through the layout Storyboard and set all the properties by using SetValue to enable calling UpdateLayout without ticking the timeline, which would cause a render. All values that are overwritten will be stored in the collection of OriginalValueRecords so that they can be replaced later.
member.param: The control whose state is changing
The storyboard holding the layout properties
The store of original values

member.summary: Take all the elements that will be moving as a result of the layout animation, and wrap them in Canvases so that they do not affect their sibling elements.
member.param: The set of elements that will be moving

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ExtendedVisualStateManager.UnwrapMovingElementsFromCanvases(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Windows.FrameworkElement})
member.summary: Take all the elements that have been moving as a result of the layout animation, and unwrap them from their Canvases.
member.param: The set of elements that have been moving

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ExtendedVisualStateManager.CopyLayoutProperties(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,System.Windows.FrameworkElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copy the layout properties from the source element to the target element, clearing them from the source.
member.param: The source of the layout properties
The destination of the layout properties

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ExtendedVisualStateManager.CreateLayoutTransitionStoryboard(System.Windows.VisualTransition,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Windows.FrameworkElement},System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Windows.FrameworkElement,System.Double})
member.summary: Create the actual storyboard that will be used to animate the transition. Use all previously calculated results.
member.param: The duration of the animation
The easing function to be used in the animation
The set of elements that will be moving
The old opacities of the elements whose viisibility is changing

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.ExtendedVisualStateManager.OriginalLayoutValueRecord
member.summary: OriginalValueRecord remembers the original value of a property that was changed in a state.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.FluidMoveScope
member.summary: This enumerated type indicates whether a FluidMoveBehavior applies to the element to which it is attached, or to the children of that element. "Self" is useful when there is a single element that should behave in a special manner; "Children" is useful when the same behavior should apply to all children of a WrapPanel or to the ItemsHost Panel of an ItemsControl.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.FluidMoveBehavior
member.summary: Behavior that watches an element (or a set of elements) for layout changes, and moves the element smoothly to the new position when needed. This behavior does not animate the size or visibility of an element; it only animates the offset of that element within its parent container.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.FluidMoveBehavior.DurationProperty
member.summary: DependencyProperty for the duration of the move.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.FluidMoveBehavior.AppliesToProperty
member.summary: DependencyProperty for the scope of the behavior. See FluidMoveScope for more details.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.FluidMoveBehavior.IsActiveProperty
member.summary: DependencyProperty for the active state of the behavior.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.FluidMoveBehavior.Duration
member.summary: The duration of the move.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.FluidMoveBehavior.AppliesTo
member.summary: Indicates whether the behavior applies just to this element, or to all children of the element (if the element is a Panel).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.FluidMoveBehavior.IsActive
member.summary: Indicates whether the behavior is currently active.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.GoToStateAction
member.summary: An action that will transition a FrameworkElement to a specified VisualState when invoked.
member.remarks: If the TargetName property is set, this action will attempt to change the state of the targeted element. If not, it walks the element tree in an attempt to locate an alternative target that defines states. ControlTemplate and UserControl are two common possibilities.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.GoToStateAction.OnTargetChanged(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary: Called when the target changes. If the TargetName property isn't set, this action has custom behavior.
member.exception: Could not locate an appropriate FrameworkElement with states.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.GoToStateAction.Invoke(System.Object)
member.summary: This method is called when some criteria is met and the action is invoked.
member.exception: Could not change the target to the specified StateName.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.GoToStateAction.UseTransitions
member.summary: Whether or not to use a VisualTransition to transition between states.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.GoToStateAction.StateName
member.summary: The name of the VisualState.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Input.KeyTrigger
member.summary: A Trigger that is triggered by a keyboard event. If the target Key and Modifiers are detected, it fires.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Input.KeyTrigger.Key
member.summary: The Key that must be pressed for the Trigger to fire.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Input.KeyTrigger.Modifiers
member.summary: The Modifiers that must be active for the Trigger to fire (the default is no modifiers pressed).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Input.KeyTrigger.ActiveOnFocus
member.summary: If true, the Trigger only listens to its trigger Source object, which means that element must have focus for the trigger to fire. If false, the Trigger listens at the root, so any unhandled KeyDown/Up messages will be caught.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Input.KeyTrigger.FiredOn
member.summary: Whether to listen to the KeyDown or KeyUp event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.LaunchUriOrFileAction
member.summary: An action that will launch a process to open a file or Uri. For files, this action will launch the default program for the given file extension. A Uri will open in a web browser.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.LaunchUriOrFileAction.Invoke(System.Object)
member.summary: This method is called when some criteria is met and the action is invoked.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.LaunchUriOrFileAction.Path
member.summary: The file or Uri to open.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior
member.summary: Repositions the attached element in response to mouse drag gestures on the element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.XProperty
member.summary: DependencyProperty for the X position of the dragged element, relative to the left of the root element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.YProperty
member.summary: DependencyProperty for the Y position of the dragged element, relative to the top of the root element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.ConstrainToParentBoundsProperty
member.summary: DependencyProperty for the ConstrainToParentBounds property. If true, the dragged element will be constrained to stay within the bounds of its parent container.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.UpdatePosition(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Attempts to update the position of the associated element to the specified coordinates.
member.param: The desired position of the element in root coordinates.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.ApplyTranslation(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Applies a relative position translation to the associated element.
member.param: The X component of the desired translation in root coordinates.
The Y component of the desired translation in root coordinates.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.ApplyTranslationTransform(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Applies the given translation to the RenderTransform of the associated element.
member.param: The X component of the translation in parent coordinates.
The Y component of the translation in parent coordinates.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.UpdatePosition
member.summary: Updates the X and Y properties based on the current rendered position of the associated element.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.IsValidConstrainedMove(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Determines whether the given cursor position should count as part of the drag operation.
member.param: The cursor position.
member.returns: true if the provided position should count as part of the drag operation; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.RectContainsRect(System.Windows.Rect,System.Windows.Rect)
member.summary: Check if one Rect is contained by another.
member.param: The containing Rect.
The contained Rect.
member.returns: true if rect1 contains rect2; otherwise, false

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.TransformAsVector(System.Windows.Media.GeneralTransform,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Transforms as vector.
member.param: The transform.
The X component of the vector.
The Y component of the vector.
member.returns: A Point containing the values of X and Y transformed by transform as a Vector.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.GetTransformOffset(System.Windows.Media.GeneralTransform)
member.summary: Gets the transform offset.
member.param: The transform.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.OnAttached
member.summary: Called after the behavior is attached to an AssociatedObject.
member.remarks: Override this to hook up functionality to the AssociatedObject.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.OnDetaching
member.summary: Called when the behavior is getting detached from its AssociatedObject, but before it has actually occurred.
member.remarks: Override this to unhook functionality from the AssociatedObject.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.DragBegun
member.summary: Occurs when a drag gesture is initiated.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.Dragging
member.summary: Occurs when a drag gesture update is processed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.DragFinished
member.summary: Occurs when a drag gesture is finished.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.X
member.summary: Gets or sets the X position of the dragged element, relative to the left of the root element. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the Y position of the dragged element, relative to the top of the root element. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.ConstrainToParentBounds
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dragged element is constrained to stay within the bounds of its parent container. This is a dependency property.
member.value: true if the dragged element should be constrained to its parents bounds; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.ActualPosition
member.summary: Gets the on-screen position of the associated element in root coordinates.
member.value: The on-screen position of the associated element in root coordinates.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.ElementBounds
member.summary: Gets the element bounds in element coordinates.
member.value: The element bounds in element coordinates.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.ParentElement
member.summary: Gets the parent element of the associated object.
member.value: The parent element of the associated object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Layout.MouseDragElementBehavior.RootElement
member.summary: Gets the root element of the scene in which the associated object is located.
member.value: The root element of the scene in which the associated object is located.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Media.PlaySoundAction
member.summary: An Action that will play a sound to completion.
member.remarks: This Action is intended for use with short sound effects that don't need to be stopped or controlled. If you're trying to create a music player or game, it may not meet your needs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Media.PlaySoundAction.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Media.PlaySoundAction.SetMediaElementProperties(System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement)
member.summary: When the Action is invoked, this method is used to customize the dynamically created MediaElement.
member.remarks: This method may be useful for Action authors who wish to extend PlaySoundAction. If you wanted to control the MediaElement Balance property, you could inherit from PlaySoundAction and override this method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Media.PlaySoundAction.Invoke(System.Object)
member.summary: This method is called when some criteria are met and the action should be invoked.
member.remarks: Each invocation of the Action plays a new sound. Although the implementation is subject-to-change, the caller should anticipate that this will create a new MediaElement, which will be cleaned up when the sound completes or if the media fails to play.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Media.PlaySoundAction.Source
member.summary: A Uri defining the location of the sound file. This is used to set the source property of the MediaElement. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks: The sound can be any file format supported by MediaElement. In the case of a video, it will only play the audio portion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Media.PlaySoundAction.Volume
member.summary: Control the volume of the sound. This is used to set the Volume property of the MediaElement. This is a dependency property.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.RemoveElementAction
member.summary: An Action that will remove the targeted element from the tree when invoked.
member.remarks: This Action may fail. The Action understands how to remove elements from common parents but not from custom collections or direct manipulation of the visual tree.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Media.StoryboardAction
member.summary: An abstract class that provides the ability to target a Storyboard.
member.remarks: For Action authors, this class provides a standard way to target a Storyboard. Design tools may choose to provide a special editing experience for classes that inherit from this Action, thereby improving the designer experience.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Media.StoryboardAction.OnStoryboardChanged(System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: This method is called when the Storyboard property is changed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Media.StoryboardAction.Storyboard
member.summary: The targeted Storyboard. This is a dependency property.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Media.ControlStoryboardAction
member.summary: An action that will change the state of a targeted storyboard when invoked.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Media.ControlStoryboardAction.Invoke(System.Object)
member.summary: This method is called when some criteria is met and the action should be invoked. This method will attempt to change the targeted storyboard in a way defined by the ControlStoryboardOption.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Media.StoryboardTrigger
member.summary: An abstract class that provides the ability to target a Storyboard.
member.remarks: For Trigger authors, this class provides a standard way to target a Storyboard. Design tools may choose to provide a special editing experience for classes that inherit from this Trigger, thereby improving the designer experience.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Media.StoryboardTrigger.OnStoryboardChanged(System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: This method is called when the Storyboard property is changed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Media.StoryboardTrigger.Storyboard
member.summary: The targeted Storyboard. This is a dependency property.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Media.StoryboardCompletedTrigger
member.summary: A trigger that listens for the completion of a Storyboard.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Media.StoryboardCompletedTrigger.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.TimerTrigger
member.summary: A Trigger that is triggered by a specified event occurring on its source and fires after a delay when that event is fired.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.TimerTrigger.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.TimerTrigger.MillisecondsPerTick
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of milliseconds to wait between ticks. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Interactivity.Core.TimerTrigger.TotalTicks
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of ticks to be fired before the Trigger is finished. This is a dependency property.

member.name: T:ExceptionStringTable
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:ExceptionStringTable.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:ExceptionStringTable.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:ExceptionStringTable.ChangePropertyActionCannotFindPropertyNameExceptionMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Cannot find a property named "{0}" on type "{1}.".

member.name: P:ExceptionStringTable.ChangePropertyActionCannotSetValueExceptionMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Cannot assign value of type "{0}" to property "{1}" of type "{2}". The "{1}" property can be assigned only values of type "{2}"..

member.name: P:ExceptionStringTable.ChangePropertyActionPropertyIsReadOnlyExceptionMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Property "{0}" defined by type "{1}" does not expose a set method and therefore cannot be modified..

member.name: P:ExceptionStringTable.GoToStateActionStateChangeFailed
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Could not change state of target {0} to {1}..

member.name: P:ExceptionStringTable.GoToStateActionTargetHasNoStateGroups
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Target {0} does not define any VisualStateGroups. .

member.name: P:ExceptionStringTable.UnsupportedRemoveTargetExceptionMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The target of the RemoveElementAction is not supported..
